TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Lewie said:
> 
> 
> Why is there a like limit?
> 

A resource that is limited is more valuable. Internet points aren't really worth anything, but if they're a little rare, you might feel good about getting one.
I clicked like, then laughed maniacally.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Lewie said:
> 
> 
> Why is there a like limit?
> 

Because people tend to abuse these things.
Why are posts in the lounge and forum games not considered part of your post count?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, DunaManiac said:
> 
> 
> Why are posts in the lounge and forum games not considered part of your post count?
> 

There are people who become overly invested in their post totals and could use the forum games and whatnot to artificially pump those up.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, DunaManiac said:
> 
> 
> Why are posts in the lounge and forum games not considered part of your post count?
> 

Because a thought-out answer to a difficult question - complete with custom-made images and a willingness to answer follow-up questions - should be more indicative of your contribution to the forum than the 857th post in a number war thread.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-09-11T23:41:24Z" title="09/11/2020 11:41  PM" data-short="3 yr">September 11, 2020</time> by Superfluous J**

> 
> 
> 17 hours ago, Superfluous J said:
> 
> 
> Because a thought-out answer to a difficult question - complete with custom-made images and a willingness to answer follow-up questions - should be more indicative of your contribution to the forum than the 857th post in a number war thread.
> 

^

> 
> 
> On 9/2/2020 at 3:37 AM, Commodore\_32 said:
> 
> 
> Imagine if an admin gets mad and ban us all
> 

Then we could not Click! anymore.

Now you might just say it's been locked since 2013, but why is this thread unlocked and locked all the time? Is that the game of the thread? I am just very confused. But hey! I can't wait for all of us to be excited for 2038 (if such day exists in the future)! I will remember at 8:14 to click the thread ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif ":sticktongue:") (if I ever remember, that's like following up to the person who gave me a baby blanket.)

You know why the thread will be unlocked at that time?

Because of the 2038 problem.

![Year_2038_problem.gif](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e9/Year_2038_problem.gif)

Like the Unix epoch, just fowards, if you want to learn more then search "2038 problem".

> 
> 
> 17 minutes ago, Commodore\_32 said:
> 
> 
> Because of the 2038 problem.
> 

Yup.

When I set up the auto-unlock, I actually put in the date as Dec 25th, 2525.

But when it went through, it defaulted to January 18th, 2038, and that's how I found out the forum is going to have to deal with the Unix 2038 problem.  One would hope there'd be an update before then...

> 
>

It's back!

> 10 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> Which part?
> 

alright, let me explain that "Weird error".

so:

there's a feature which marks the last time the user visited the ksp forums.

Squad's account has visited the forums august 31 of 2018.

but Squad posted a topic in this year in july 19.

Like, how did Squad posted a topic above the LTTUVTKSPF time without making the LTTUVTKSPF feature mark the activity?

Technically it is supposed to display july 19 of 2020 as the last time Squad has visited,not august 31 of 2018.

Hey guys o/

I'm curious, a question please, if I may: How do you select the "Threads of the month"?

Can ordinary users like me make suggestions? If so: where, how? Or what are your criteria?
